title: Can Windows 10 Revive PC Sales?
authors: Marcelo Prince,Alberto Cervantes,The Wall Street Journal
description: Personal computer sales, which have declined each year since 2012, are forecast to fall again this year. Microsoft Corp. is releasing a new version of its Windows software on Wednesday, but for the first time is making it a free upgrade for existing customers. It’s not clear whether Windows 10 will spark holiday sales of consumer PCs. Most industry watchers expect big businesses to wait until 2016 to adopt the software, which has received...

title: How 20 Years of Amazon Changed Retail
authors: Marcelo Prince,Sarah Slobin,The Wall Street Journal
description: By Marcelo Prince and Sarah Slobin July 15, 2015 6:07 pm ET Since it opened its website in July 1995, Amazon.com Inc. AMZN 3.11% has grown from a seller of books into one of the world’s biggest retailers. Its growth has been fueled by a consumer shift to online shopping and Amazon’s willingness to sacrifice profits to expand. Here’s a look at 20 years of sales for Amazon and three close competitors— Target Corp.

title: How Do Companies Give to Charity?
authors: Marcelo Prince,Erik Brynildsen,The Wall Street Journal
description: Data reported by 271 corporations, from American Express to Verizon , provide insight into how the biggest U.S. businesses–and their employees–give back to their communities. The study, by the non-profit group CECP, reveals that the median amount of giving by these companies was $18.5 million last year, while companies in the top quartile of the study gave a minimum of $48.9 million in 2014.

title: What Is a Gutenberg Bible Worth?
authors: Joe G. Shoulak,Marcelo Prince,The Wall Street Journal
description: • Invalid email address. • You can't enter more than 20 emails. • Seperate multiple addresses with Commas. • Must enter an email address. • You must enter the verification code below to send. • Invalid entry: Please type the verification code again.

title: What Is the Future of Nuclear Power?
authors: Marcelo Prince,Joseph Shoulak,The Wall Street Journal
description: The U.S. has been making electricity from nuclear energy since the 1950s. Today, 99 nuclear power plants generate about 19% of the country’s electricity, but most reactors are more than 30 years old. Five new nuclear reactors are under construction, but low natural gas prices depress the prospects for others. As many as three dozen reactors are considered at risk of closure for financial reasons. Here’s the state of the industry:

title: Do Fewer Airlines Mean More On-Time Flights?
authors: Marcelo Prince,Alberto Cervantes,The Wall Street Journal
description: A series of mergers since 2008 have left four U.S. airlines controlling about 80% of domestic seats. The combinations–plus some trips through bankruptcy and lower fuel prices–have created more profitable and efficient businesses. But the mergers haven’t necessarily produced more on-time flights or fewer lost bags. Here’s a look at on-time stats for the domestic flights of the top four U.S. airlines last year–and where each carrier stood before the mergers.

title: Who Is Winning the Fast Food Fight Online?
authors: Marcelo Prince,Carlos A. Tovar,The Wall Street Journal
description: It’s easy to count who has the most Twitter followers or Facebook fans, but data from analytics firm Unmetric reveals just how differently fast-food chains are using social media to engage with consumers. Among the discoveries: McDonald’s took longer than its burger rivals to respond to Twitter mentions, but it responded more often than either Wendy’s or Burger King.

title: A Year’s Worth of Hollywood’s Films
authors: Christopher Kaeser,Marcelo Prince,The Wall Street Journal
description: People around the globe spent $36.4 billion going to the movies last year, with a record $26 billion in ticket sales outside the U.S. and Canada. Here’s a breakdown of the box office for the U.S. films that were released in more than 2,500 North American theaters in 2014. Among the surprises: There was only one film that reached $1 billion in global ticket sales and only one of the 98 films was rated “G.”

title: What Is the State of the U.S. Gun Business?
authors: Carlos A. Tovar,Marcelo Prince,The Wall Street Journal
description: After several years of strong sales to civilians worried about new regulations, big U.S. firearms makers have recently reported lower sales. The overall number of American households with guns is declining and demand for FBI background checks to purchase firearms has slowed. Here’s a snapshot of the industry:

title: How Much U.S. Oil and Gas Comes From Fracking?
authors: Marcelo Prince,Carlos A. Tovar,The Wall Street Journal
description: By Marcelo Prince and Carlos A. Tovar Apr 1, 2015 3:12 pm ET Hydraulic fracturing has unleashed vast new quantities of crude oil and natural gas. The percentage of fuel flowing from shale-rock compared with traditional oil and gas fields has been steadily rising. But lackluster energy demand and low prices are expected to curb growth later this year. Here's a graphic that helps explain fracking:

title: Corporate Intelligence
authors: Joe G. Shoulak,Marcelo Prince,The Wall Street Journal
description: Making sure products don’t fall apart or emit dangerous chemicals is crucial for any retailer, but for a global company like IKEA, the process is fraught with complexity. The Swedish furniture retailer last year named a global head of quality, a role that didn’t exist before.

title: Palestinian Authority’s Government Resigns, Yielding to International Pressure
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Fatima Karim,The Wall Street Journal

title: Negotiators in Paris Press On in Bid to Pause Israel-Hamas Fighting
description: JERUSALEM—American and Arab officials are intensifying efforts to narrow the gaps between Israel and Hamas in a deal to pause the fighting in Gaza and free Israeli hostages, Egyptian officials said, after a crucial meeting in Paris helped revive stalled negotiations.  The mediators’ main challenge is to produce an agreement convincing Hamas that a permanent cease-fire is eventually possible at the end of a humanitarian pause, while allowing Israel to avoid any such commitment, the officials said.

title: The Aging Bureaucrat Frustrating the West’s Plan for Gaza
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Fatima Karim,The Wall Street Journal
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank—Whenever Mahmoud Abbas is quizzed about who he wants as his successor, the 88-year-old president of the Palestinian Authority gives his standard reply: no one yet. His father lived to over 100, so why fret about finding a replacement, an Egyptian official recalls Abbas responding to the longstanding question of his succession.

title: Threat of Israeli Offensive Hangs Over Packed Gaza Border City as U.S. Warns of ‘Disaster’
description: JERUSALEM—The Israeli military pressed its campaign against Hamas around Rafah, as U.S. and United Nations officials warned of the dire humanitarian consequences of expanding its operations in the Gaza border city where more than a million people have sought refuge. Washington has signaled increasing discomfort with the continued offensive in Gaza, with President Biden on Thursday calling Israel’s conduct there in response to Hamas’s Oct.

title: U.N. Says Gaza Aid Is at Risk as Nations Pause Relief-Agency Funding
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,David Luhnow,The Wall Street Journal
description: “I urge countries who have suspended their funding to reconsider their decisions before Unrwa is forced to suspend its humanitarian response,” he said.

title: 以色列军队包围汗尤尼斯，准备迎接残酷巷战
description: 周三，以色列坦克在汗尤尼斯附近的加沙边境上行驶。 图片来源：Amir Levy/Getty Images 以色列军方称，以军包围加沙地带南部城市汗尤尼斯之后，正在向汗尤尼斯西部推进，并在与哈马斯一些最强大的战士展开激战。由于数十万流离失所的巴勒斯坦人涌入，汗尤尼斯的人口已经大增。 以色列周三表示，正利用狙击手、坦克和空中火力打击哈马斯武装分子，其目标是摧毁该组织使用的复杂地道网络和基础设施。以色列官员说，他们相信哈马斯领导人和以色列人质都在这座城市里。 向汗尤尼斯的军事推进反映出战争进入了一个新阶段，以色列开始转向对以军来说更加耗时和危险的城市巷战。 耶路撒冷战略与安全研究所(Jerusalem Institute for Strategy and Security)高级研究员、以色列退役上校Gabi Siboni说：“当你越接近敌人的核心及其资源时，其抵抗就越强烈。”他表示：“汗尤尼斯是哈马斯的一个重要据点。” Copyright ©2022 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

title: Israeli Military Braces for Grueling Urban Battle as It Encircles Khan Younis
description: Israel’s troops engage in urban combat with Hamas militants in the city in southern GazaThe Israeli military said it was pushing into the west of Khan Younis and was engaged in fierce fighting with some of Hamas’s strongest fighters after encircling the southern Gaza Strip city, where the population has swelled by hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians.

title: Israel Intensifies Raids Against Palestinians in West Bank
authors: Sune Engel Rasmussen,Omar Abdel-Baqui,Fatima Karim,The Wall Street Journal
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank—The Israeli-occupied West Bank has become an increasingly deadly front in a Middle East conflict that has spread beyond the war in Gaza, with near-daily Israeli raids into Palestinian villages and cities which Israel says are aimed at uprooting growing militant activity and preventing new attacks.

title: 美国加强对也门胡塞武装的打击
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/美国加强对也门胡塞武装的打击-77e4e21b
description: 周三，也门萨那，人们在声援巴勒斯坦人民的示威中高喊口号。 图片来源：Osamah Yahya/Zuma Press 美国军方称，夜间袭击了胡塞武装在也门的武器，这些武器对红海的商船和美国海军船只构成威胁。这是美国近几周来第四次袭击胡塞武装控制的领土。安全分析人士警告说，该地区不断升级的紧张局势有可能把更多方面卷入一场不断扩大的战争。 美方称其已向14枚胡塞武装装载待发的导弹开火。美国中央司令部(U.S. Central Command)周四表示：“这些打击行动以及我们采取的其他行动，将削弱胡塞武装继续肆无忌惮地袭击红海、曼德海峡和亚丁湾的国际和商业航运的能力。” 五角大楼的一位官员说，估计胡塞武装武库的大约四分之一现在已被摧毁。 Copyright ©2022 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All Rights Reserved. 87990cbe856818d5eddac44c7b1cdeb8

title: U.S. Steps Up Strikes on Houthis in Yemen
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Dion Nissenbaum,The Wall Street Journal
description: The U.S. military said it struck Houthi weaponry in Yemen that threatened merchant and U.S. Navy vessels in the Red Sea overnight, America’s fourth strike on Houthi-held territory in recent weeks as security analysts warn that rising tensions across the region threaten to pull more parties into a widening war. The U.S. said it fired at 14 Houthi missiles that were loaded to be fired.

authors: Sune Engel Rasmussen,Omar Abdel-Baqui,Fatima Karim,Paul Krugman,myemail.constantcontact.com
description: Quotes of the Day:"If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster." – Isaac Asimov"Fear paralyzes; curiosity empowers. title: Hamas Leader Killed in Beirut Was Linchpin of Relations With Iran, Hezbollah
description: The killing on Tuesday night of a senior Hamas leader marked the biggest hit to the group’s top leadership in years, taking out a key player who was responsible for aligning the Palestinian militant group with Iran and Iran’s proxy Hezbollah. Saleh al-Arouri was killed in Beirut in a suspected Israeli strike, although Israel hasn’t officially claimed responsibility.

authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Seth J. Frantzman,Alistair MacDonald,Jen Easterly,constantcontact.com
description: Quotes of the Day:"Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster."– Nietzsche"No problem can withstand the assault of sustained thinking."– Voltaire"Be a free thinker and don't accept everything as truth. title: How an Israeli Airstrike on a Hamas Commander Also Killed Scores of Civilians
authors: David Cloud,Dov Lieber,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: The alley-like streets and closely spaced buildings of the Block 6 neighborhood in Gaza’s Jabalia refugee camp were packed with people the afternoon of Oct. 31. Some stood in a long line at the local bakery. Others were crammed more tightly than usual into tiny apartments.

title: 以色列空袭范围扩大至加沙南部，重新调整军事行动重点
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/以色列空袭范围扩大至加沙南部-重新调整军事行动重点-5f116c86
description: 加沙南部汗尤尼斯上空浓烟滚滚。 图片来源：said khatib/Agence France-Presse/Getty Images 以色列军方正在将空袭范围扩大到加沙地带南部的敏感地区，将军事行动的重点转向汗尤尼斯和重要的边境城市拉法，之前以色列方面接近实现其所称的在作战意义上控制加沙北部。 以色列军队说，最近几天他们从陆地、海上和空中打击了100多个目标，包括他们所说的武装分子基础设施。据巴勒斯坦权力机构官方通讯社Wafa称，有几次空袭发生在拉法。在以色列发出让巴勒斯坦人离开加沙北部的指示后，数十万巴勒斯坦人已通过拉法逃离。大部分援助物资也是经由拉法进入加沙这块飞地，外界普遍认为拉法不太可能遭到空袭或地面袭击。 巴勒斯坦医疗官员周一表示，在过去24小时内，加沙全境约有250人丧生。 Copyright ©2022 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All Rights Reserved. 87990cbe856818d5eddac44c7b1cdeb8

title: 以色列安全内阁将讨论埃及的和平提案
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/以色列安全内阁将讨论埃及的和平提案-234a1b2d

title: Israel Weighs Egyptian Peace Deal as Airstrikes Expand to Southern Gaza
Israel Airstrikes Expand to Southern Gaza as It Reframes Focus
description: Palestinian medical officials said that about 250 people had been killed across the territory in the past 24 hours. Analysts say the Israeli military is seeking to dismantle the smuggling infrastructure they say exists in and around Rafah, which straddles the Egyptian border and is near the Gaza border crossing with Israel, Kerem Shalom. Israel has previously voiced its concerns about military equipment used by Hamas making its way into Gaza through the Rafah crossing.

title: Israeli Military Says It Is Close to Controlling Gaza’s North
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Carrie Keller-Lynn,The Wall Street Journal
description: U.N. says the humanitarian crisis is growing as Israel orders already displaced Palestinians to relocate againTEL AVIV—The Israeli military said it is approaching what it calls full operational control in the northern Gaza Strip and ordered tens of thousands of residents who have already been displaced to evacuate again, to another central area.

title: Israeli Economy Reels From Gaza Conflict as Labor Pool Shrinks
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Shoshanna Solomon,The Wall Street Journal
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank—Nir Yanushevsky heads a real estate and construction firm north of Tel Aviv that before the war had about 1,000 employees. But Israel’s decision to suspend Palestinian work permits after the Oct. 7 attacks has upended his business. “You wake up one morning and one-third of your workers are gone,” he said. So is Mustafa Irzikat’s job.

title: Christmas Celebrations in Bethlehem Muted Amid War
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Tanya Habjouqa,The Wall Street Journal
description: Bethlehem, the birthplace of Jesus, is usually the scene of vibrant Christmas festivities, with concerts, parades and parties in addition to religious services. But church leaders in the city this year are calling for more somber commemorations of the holiday because of the high death toll in the war between Israel and militant group Hamas.

title: Israeli Military Steps Up Raids in Flashpoint West Bank City
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Fatima Karim,The Wall Street Journal
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank—Israeli forces are engaged in one of their most extensive operations in the West Bank city of Jenin in years, laying siege to a densely-populated refugee camp in what they say is an attempt to root out militant units there, while continuing their campaign against Hamas fighters in Gaza.

title: Palestinian Families Seek Medical Care Outside Besieged Gaza
description: By | Photographs by Natalie Naccache for The Wall Street Journal ARISH, Egypt—Nazha Abu Dhaahir was relieved when her 7-year-old son Yousef was chosen to leave the Gaza Strip for Abu Dhabi for treatment of his hemophilia, which can render any injury fatal. But that meant leaving two sons who have the same blood disorder in a war zone. She and Yousef rushed to exit Gaza last week, with permission from authorities there, and within hours had boarded an Emirati plane in the Sinai Peninsula.

title: Palestinians Face Harrowing Hunt for Safety as Israel-Hamas War Intensifies
authors: Chao Deng,Menna Farouk,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: The first call came at 1:30 a.m. on Oct. 8. The recorded voice instructed doctor Hussam Abuouda, his wife and five children to get out. Leave Beit Hanoun, the city at the Israeli border in northern Gaza, Abuouda recalls the unidentified man saying in Arabic. He had received a call like this before, in the 2014 Israel-Gaza war. That time, he moved out for 45 days, then returned to repair his damaged home. This night felt more urgent.

title: Hamas Sees Surge of Support as Palestinian Prisoners Are Released
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Fatima Karim,Benoit Faucon,The Wall Street Journal
description: By , Fatima AbdulKarim and | Photographs by Tanya Habjouqa/Noor Images for The Wall Street Journal BEITUNIA, West Bank—After more than a year of detention, Azhar Assaf has finally returned to her home in the occupied West Bank. Although she doesn’t consider herself to be political, she says she owes her freedom to Hamas. Assaf and other freed prisoners, many of whom have been held without trial, are attributing their release to Hamas, with some openly praising the group.

title: Vandals deface Bill Shorten’s office for a second time amid protests over Israel-Hamas conflict
authors: Dov Lieber,Omar Abdel-Baqui,Greg Sheridan,Elise Kaine,The Australian
description: A minister’s office was splashed with red and “dial down the apartheid” was graffitied on its doors amid protests over the Israel-Hamas conflict. Government Services Minister Bill Shorten confirmed his Moonee Ponds office had been targeted early on Thursday morning. “At the end of the day, nobody got hurt. We’ll just clean it all off and be open for business,” he told Melbourne radio station 3AW.

title: Inside Israel’s Campaign to Prove a Gaza Hospital Was a Hamas Command Center
authors: Dov Lieber,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: The Israeli military has stepped up its efforts to produce evidence that Gaza’s largest hospital was a Hamas command center, as the humanitarian fallout from war and seizure of Al-Shifa Hospital has heaped pressure on Israel. In recent days, the Israeli military has released a series of videos and photos from the hospital that show further details of a tunnel uncovered at the site and security-camera footage of two hostages who were brought there on Oct.

title: 以色列军队包围加沙地区另一家医院
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/以色列军队包围加沙地区另一家医院-2ff6012a

title: Israeli Military Encircles Another Gaza Hospital, Doctors Say
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Chao Deng,The Wall Street Journal
description: Patients and staff at a second hospital in Gaza, Indonesia Hospital, braced for Israeli troops to enter the complex Monday after tanks surrounded it and artillery shelling hit the building, killing about a dozen people including patients, according to Palestinian officials. The military activity is centered on a facility that Israeli armed forces said earlier this month was built on top of underground Hamas outposts that were present in 2010.

title: Israel-Hamas War Puts Palestinians Back on Arab World’s Agenda
authors: Stephen Kalin,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: AMMAN, Jordan—Israel’s fierce response to last month’s cross-border assault by Hamas militants from Gaza has reinvigorated support for Palestinians in the Arab world and stirred popular anger—not just at Israel and its biggest ally, the U.S., but also at Arab governments. Some in the Arab and wider Muslim world joined global condemnations of Hamas, which carried out attacks on a music festival and agricultural communities in southern Israel.

title: ガザ出身労働者の苦難 ハマス攻撃で生活一変
Detained, Beaten, Underfed: Gazan Workers in Israel Describe Ordeal After Oct. 7 Attack
description: “We were workers with legal permits,” said Skaik, who was later released. “The war happened while we were inside Israel—we had nothing to do with it. Why are we being punished for it?”The Oct. 7 attacks and the war that followed upended a system under which Israel in recent years provided work permits to some 18,000 Palestinians from the Gaza Strip, where unemployment and poverty rates are high.

title: 以色列继续在加沙推进，并警告称战争可能扩大

title: Israel Warns of Wider War as It Presses On in Gaza
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Dov Lieber,The Wall Street Journal
description: Palestinian militants in Lebanon said they fired rockets on Sunday that reached deep into northern Israel. Israeli officials say such rocket attacks are done with the approval of Hezbollah, the Iranian-backed militant group. Hezbollah has claimed responsibility for using armed drones to attack Israeli military positions along Israel’s northern border in recent days.

title: Israel Warns of Wider War as It Presses On in Gaza
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Dov Lieber,The Wall Street Journal
description: The chance of a full-scale war breaking out between Israel and forces in Lebanon increased in recent days, Israeli officials said, even as fighting continued around the Gaza Strip’s biggest hospital, crippling the facility where doctors said hundreds of civilians were sheltering and more patients were dying.

title: Gaza’s Al-Shifa Hospital Crippled as Power Runs Out and Israeli Forces Move Closer
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,David Cloud,Chao Deng,Margherita Stancati,The Wall Street Journal
description: Israeli forces said they were engaged in fierce fighting early Saturday around Gaza City’s Al-Shifa Hospital, where Israel says Hamas has positioned fighters near thousands of displaced people and hundreds of patients amid worsening conditions at the facility.

title: 以色列-加沙战争造成的联合国工作人员死亡人数创史上单次冲突新高

link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/加沙电信在第三次中断后逐步恢复-4bdf8cc1

title: Israel Steps Up Arrests in the West Bank in Wake of Hamas Attacks
description: Israel has more than doubled the rate at which it makes arrests across the occupied West Bank since it was attacked by Hamas militants from Gaza a month ago, an escalation that analysts say risks triggering wider unrest. The Israeli military says the arrests are part of counterterrorism measures meant to stamp out Hamas’s West Bank network, in an effort to eradicate the U.S.-designated terrorist group following the unprecedented Oct. 7 assault from the Palestinian enclave.

title: Israel Says Corridor Is Opening for Northern Gazans to Flee South
description: The Israeli military said it is preparing to open a humanitarian corridor, allowing people in northern Gaza to flee south, as U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken toured the Middle East calling for a pause in the Israel-Hamas war and the United Nations warned its operations in the enclave were on the verge of shutting down. The Israel Defense Forces said it planned to allow traffic on Salah al-Din Road—a major north-south thoroughfare in the strip—for three hours Saturday afternoon.

title: 以色列称对加沙贾巴利亚的空袭击毙一名哈马斯指挥官
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/以色列称对加沙贾巴利亚的空袭击毙一名哈马斯指挥官-94c937c9

title: ISRAEL PUSHES DEEPER INTO GAZA AMID US PRESSURE FOR A PAUSE
authors: Stephen Kalin,Chao Deng,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: ABSTRACTIsraeli soldiers push into Gaza in apparent attempt to trap Hamas in northern part of enclave, suggesting campaign will move deliberately in stages; Israel appears to be responding to US pressure in restoring Internet and phone communications in Gaza after cutting them on Oct 27; map; photos (M)

title: U.S. Strikes Syrian Militias as Israel Makes Fresh Incursion Into Gaza
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Nancy Youssef,Gordon Lubold,The Wall Street Journal
description: U.S. military forces struck two bases in Syria in what the Pentagon said was a move to deter Iran-backed militias from broadening the conflict in the Middle East, while Israeli ground forces conducted an incursion into the Gaza Strip for the second consecutive day ahead of a widely-anticipated ground war.

title: イスラエル、ガザ侵攻保留 米の要請受け入れ - WSJ
authors: Dion Nissenbaum,Gordon Lubold,Dov Lieber,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal (Japan)

title: Israel Battles on Multiple Fronts as Conflict Risks Spreading
description: Israeli forces battled on four fronts Wednesday, hitting targets in Lebanon, Syria, the West Bank and Gaza and fighting off a sea incursion, in a new sign the war with Hamas was slowly expanding to Iran-backed forces around the region. The Israeli Air Force bombed roadblocks in Gaza that it said Hamas used to stop civilians fleeing from Gaza City to the south.

title: Israel Intensifies Gaza Bombing, Targets West Bank Militants With Airstrike
description: The Israeli military struck a mosque compound in the West Bank’s city of Jenin that it said was being used by militants to plan attacks. It was one of few airstrikes since 2006 in the West Bank, where the Israeli military has recently tended to rely on ground troops to conduct raids, which have escalated in the past few years. About 90 Palestinians have been killed in the West Bank since Hamas’s Oct.

title: Israel Intensifies Gaza Bombing, Targets West Bank Militants With Airstrike
description: Israel intensified its bombing of targets on three fronts, including a rare airstrike in the West Bank, as Palestinian casualties mounted and the humanitarian crisis in the Gaza Strip deepened. The Israeli military struck a mosque compound in the West Bank’s city of Jenin that it said was being used by militants to plan attacks.

title: Gaza Receives First Aid Trucks Since Hamas Attack as Egypt Border Opens Briefly
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Chao Deng,The Wall Street Journal
description: A convoy of trucks carrying humanitarian aid entered Gaza for the first time since the Oct. 7 attacks in Israel by Hamas militants. Egyptian officials said 20 trucks filled with medical supplies and some food crossed into Gaza on Saturday morning before Egypt closed the border again. Citizens of the U.S. and other foreign countries stuck in Gaza weren’t able to enter Egypt, the officials said. Copyright ©2023 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All Rights Reserved. 87990cbe856818d5eddac44c7b1cdeb8

title: ガザ病院爆発、世界のイスラム教徒怒る
Gaza Hospital Blast Reverberates Across Muslim World
description: The explosion at a Gaza hospital Tuesday night set off a wave of protests across much of the Middle East and the broader Muslim world, some of them calling for death to Israel. Hamas immediately blamed Israeli air strikes for the blast at the Al-Ahli Arab hospital and said 500 people had been killed. Israel, the U.S. and independent security experts on Wednesday cast doubt on Hamas claims, saying the preliminary evidence pointed to a Palestinian militant group.

title: 加沙一家医院遇袭，至少500人丧生
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/巴勒斯坦官员称加沙医院遇袭-至少500人丧生-ab89345c
description: 加沙一家医院周二遭到袭击，造成至少500人死亡，这是加沙地带最致命的单起暴力事件之一。几个小时后，美国总统拜登(Joe Biden)预计将访问以色列，以示支持。 哈马斯和巴勒斯坦官员指责以色列发动了袭击。以色列总理办公室表示，有明显迹象表明，这次袭击是巴勒斯坦伊斯兰圣战组织误击所致，但该组织否认了这一说法。此次空袭的来源暂时无法得到证实。 al-Ahli阿拉伯医院(Al-Ahli Arab Hospital)由英国圣公会传教士于1880年代创建，该医院遭到袭击在整个阿拉伯世界引起了反响，引发了街头抗议，并破坏了为释放人质、为外国人士安全离开加沙创造通道的微妙外交努力。沙特阿拉伯王储穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼(Mohammed bin Salman)一直在寻求与以色列达成正常化协议，但一名王室顾问表示，这个想法现在已经夭折。

title: Israel Attacks 200 Targets in Gaza Ahead of Biden Visit
authors: Rory Jones,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: Listen to article(2 minutes)The Israeli military said Tuesday that it attacked 200 targets in Gaza overnight, as aid workers warned of a looming humanitarian collapse in the strip and U.S. diplomats prepared for President Biden to visit Israel. Copyright ©2023 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All Rights Reserved. 87990cbe856818d5eddac44c7b1cdeb8

title: U.N. Urges Israel to Rescind Gaza Evacuation Order
authors: Chao Deng,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: Early Friday, Israel’s military said it had sent a message, along with a map, to people in Gaza that they should move to the south of the enclave because military operations would take place in the densely populated area of Gaza City. The demand came as the military has been massing troops at the southern border with Gaza, in preparation for a potential ground invasion.

title: 联合国：以色列要求其在加沙内疏散110万人
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/联合国-以色列要求其在加沙内疏散110万人-3f806bf1

title: The Latest Contention in Israel-Occupied West Bank: Illegal Trash Dumps
description: The landfill is one of few official Palestinian-run sites, but its operator was forced by the Israeli military to accept trash from settlements, which it doesn’t have the capacity to handle.

title: New Quarrel in Israel-Occupied West Bank: Where to Dump the Trash
description: ATARA, West Bank—Thaer Atary and his family live just steps away from an overflowing makeshift dumpsite that sends noxious fumes drifting into their home in this mountaintop Palestinian village. “A dump should never be this close to residents,” said Mr. Atary, worrying for the health of his children as the stench of rotting trash wafts through the air.

title: Will Smith Apologizes to Chris Rock in New Video
description: “There is no part of me that thinks that was the right way to behave in that moment,” Mr. Smith said Friday. “I am deeply remorseful.” During the 94th Academy Awards presentation in March, Mr. Rock made a joke that Mr. Smith’s wife, Jada Pinkett Smith, ought to do a “G.I. Jane” sequel. It was a reference to her short hair—Demi Moore played the role in the original with a shaved head. Ms. Pinkett Smith has said she has alopecia, a hair-loss condition that she has worked to raise awareness about.

title: Hope Solo, Former U.S. Women’s Soccer Star, Pleads Guilty to Driving While Impaired
description: Hope Solo, former U.S. women’s soccer star, pleaded guilty to driving while impaired in North Carolina, months after police found her intoxicated and passed out in the driver’s seat of a running car that had her children in the back seat. Ms. Solo, 40 years old, received a sentence of 30 days in rehabilitation, according to the Forsyth County district attorney’s office. Her lawyer, Christopher Clifton, said she voluntarily went to an inpatient rehabilitation center.

title: SIXTH MAN CLEARED IN CENTRAL PARK CASE
description: ABSTRACTSeven Lopez, who was 15 years old when he was arrested with five other teenagers in connection with rape of Central Park jogger in April 1989 and served three years in jail after pleading guilty to mugging male jogger, has had his conviction vacated; other five accused settled with city in 2014 for $40 million (M)

title: The Sixth Teen Charged in Central Park Jogger Case Is Exonerated Three Decades Later
description: A man who spent more than three years in prison in connection with the Central Park jogger case had his conviction vacated Monday, more than 30 years after the incident. Steven Lopez, who was arrested in 1989 when he was 15 years old, was the sixth of several teenagers who were charged and wrongfully convicted in connection with a string of attacks.

title: Buses Bringing Migrants to D.C. From Texas, Arizona Tax Nonprofits, Local Governments
authors: Michelle Hackman,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: July 22, 2022 11:00 am ETWASHINGTON—A continuing effort by Texas and Arizona to bus asylum-seeking migrants from the southern border to the nation’s capital is beginning to strain city government and local nonprofits. The mayors of Washington and New York City are asking the Biden administration for financial assistance to help with the influx.

title: NBC Crew Member Killed on Set of ‘Law & Order’ in New York City
description: Motive isn’t known and suspect is on the loose, police said July 19, 2022 1:25 pm ET An NBCUniversal crew member was shot and killed on the set of “Law & Order: Organized Crime” in New York City Tuesday, according to police and NBCUniversal. The crew member, a 31-year-old man, was working parking enforcement on the set in the Greenpoint neighborhood of Brooklyn, a New York City Police Department detective said.

title: Four People Dead After Two Planes Collide in Midair Near Las Vegas
description: The collision occurred while one of the planes was preparing to land at North Las Vegas Airport Updated July 18, 2022 12:07 pm ET Four people have died after two small planes collided in midair near Las Vegas, officials said. The collision, which occurred on Sunday around noon local time, happened while one of the planes was preparing to land at North Las Vegas Airport, according to the Federal Aviation Administration.

title: Arizona Moves to Restrict Filming of Police Officers
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Ginger Adams Otis,The Wall Street Journal
description: It also prohibits filming within 8 feet of officers interacting with what the law calls “an emotionally disturbed person or disorderly” individual exhibiting abnormal behavior. The bill won approval in the Arizona legislature along party lines, with Republicans voting in favor of it. Mr. Ducey signed the bill into law Wednesday. The bill was sponsored by Arizona state Rep. John Kavanagh, who worked as a police officer on the East Coast for two decades, according to his campaign website.

title: Gas Prices Have Fallen for Three Weeks. The Relief May Be Temporary
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Lauryn Azu,The Wall Street Journal
description: The price of gasoline in the U.S. fell for 23 consecutive days through Thursday, after hitting a record last month. But analysts said prices may rise again if demand from drivers increases and supplies are constrained. The average cost of a gallon of unleaded gas was $4.75 Thursday. That’s down about 5% since prices hit their highest point, $5.02, on June 14, according to data from OPIS, an energy-data and analytics provider.

title: Two Philadelphia Police Officers Shot During July Fourth Celebration
description: Updated July 5, 2022 11:59 am ETTwo police officers were struck by gunfire in Philadelphia during a Fourth of July celebration in the city, hours after a mass shooter at a Chicago-area Independence Day parade killed six people. Officials in Philadelphia said Tuesday morning that it isn’t known where the gunshots that hit the officers came from.

title: Drivers Endure Near-Record Gas Prices During July 4 Travel
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Hardika Singh,The Wall Street Journal
description: Americans are still paying close to $5 at the pump. That isn’t going to stop them from hitting the road this July Fourth, analysts say. The average price for a gallon of gasoline Friday was $4.84, compared with $3.12 during the same day last year, according to data from OPIS, an energy-data and analytics provider.

title: ‘Cryptoqueen’ Is Now on FBI’s 10 Most Wanted List
description: Ruja Ignatova in 2016. The FBI put the woman known as the Cryptoqueen on its 10 Most Wanted list. The woman alleged to be at the heart of one of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency frauds is now on the Federal Bureau of Investigation’s 10 Most Wanted Fugitives list, according to the agency. Ruja Ignatova is accused of operating a world-wide pyramid scheme that took in more than $4 billion from 2014 through 2016 through the purported cryptocurrency OneCoin, according to law enforcement.

title: Man Who Allegedly Slapped Rudy Giuliani on Back Charged With Second-Degree Assault
description: A grocery store employee who slapped former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani on the back was arrested Sunday and charged with second-degree assault, police said. In video posted to social media on Monday, the 78-year-old Mr. Giuliani said the man slapped his back at a ShopRite grocery store on Staten Island while he was campaigning for his son, a New York gubernatorial candidate.

title: U.N. Agency Finds Israeli Forces Shot Palestinian-American Journalist
description: June 24, 2022 1:26 pm ETThe United Nations office for human rights said its investigation into the death of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh found Israeli forces fired the shots that killed her last month. Israeli authorities initially said indiscriminate firing from Palestinians killed Ms. Abu Akleh, which the U.N. Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights said is inconsistent with its findings.

title: $100 Million in Cryptocurrency Stolen by Hackers
description: Hackers have stolen roughly $100 million in cryptocurrency from a blockchain bridge, technology company Harmony said Thursday. Harmony, which hosts the Horizon bridge that allows users to send crypto between different blockchains, said on Twitter it is working with the Federal Bureau of Investigation and forensic specialists to identify who is behind the theft.

title: Hackers steal $100m in cryptocurrency
description: Hackers have stolen roughly $100m in cryptocurrency from a blockchain bridge, technology company Harmony said 23 June. Harmony, which hosts the Horizon bridge that allows users to send crypto between different blockchains, said on Twitter it is working with the Federal Bureau of Investigation and forensic specialists to identify who is behind the theft.

title: A Mosque Over 1,200 Years Old Was Just Discovered in Israeli Desert
description: Archaeologists in Israel say they discovered an ancient mosque in the Negev desert, providing details of early Islamic history in the region. The mosque is over 1,200 years old and dates back to the first few centuries of Islamic civilization, according to the Israel Antiquities Authority, which released information about the discovery on Wednesday.

title: Pornhub Parent Company’s CEO, COO Are Departing as Scrutiny Builds Over Alleged Nonconsensual Content
description: June 21, 2022 7:04 pm ETTwo top executives at the parent company of major pornography site Pornhub have resigned, the company said Tuesday, amid scrutiny of alleged nonconsensual sexually explicit videos hosted on the site. MindGeek Chief Executive Feras Antoon and Chief Operating Officer David Tassillo are leaving, the privately held company said in a statement. The leadership changes have been in the works since early 2022, MindGeek said. Messrs.

title: CEO, COO of Pornhub parent company resign as scrutiny over videos builds
description: Two top executives at the parent company of major pornography site Pornhub have resigned, the company said Tuesday, amid scrutiny of alleged nonconsensual sexually explicit videos hosted on the site. MindGeek Chief Executive Feras Antoon and Chief Operating Officer David Tassillo are leaving, the privately held company said in a statement. The leadership changes have been in the works since early 2022, MindGeek said. Antoon and Tassillo will remain shareholders, the company said.

title: Pornhub母公司CEO和COO辞职，公司因涉嫌提供非自愿性内容受到调查
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/pornhub母公司ceo和coo辞职-公司因涉嫌提供非自愿性内容受到调查-11655856006
description: 主要色情网站PornHub的母公司周二表示，两名高管已辞职。该公司涉嫌在该网站上发布非自愿性质的露骨色情视频，目前正在接受审查。 这家非上市公司在一份声明中说，Mindgeek首席执行官Feras Antoon和首席运营官David Tassillo离职。MindGeek表示，领导层更迭自2022年初以来一直在进行中。该公司说，Antoon和Tassillo仍是股东。 本月早些时候，包括《纽约客》(the New Yorker) 在内的几家新闻机构的调查报告称，世界上最受欢迎的色情网站之一PornHub被指提供了包括非自愿和未成年人性行为在内的视频内容。《华尔街日报》(The Wall Street Journal)尚未独立核实这些文章中的指控。 一位发言人说，上述高管的离职与针对MindGeek的指控无关。该公司说，已经制定了保障措施，并删除了儿童性虐待材料的事件。该公司表示：“MindGeek拥有比互联网上任何其他主要平台都更全面、更有效的政策。”...

title: Uber Is Bringing Back Shared Passenger Rides in Several U.S. Cities
description: Uber Technologies Inc. is bringing back shared passenger rides in several U.S. cities, including New York City and San Francisco, for the first time in more than two years, as high fares pinch riders’ pockets. With UberX Share, riders can receive an upfront discount and get up to 20% off the total fare if matched with another rider along their route.

title: Reeling Black Residents Decry Years of Disinvestment in East Buffalo
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Joseph De Avila,The Wall Street Journal
description: By Omar Abdel-Baqui and Joseph De Avila | Photographs by Lauren Petracca for The Wall Street Journal June 19, 2022 10:00 am ETBUFFALO, N.Y.—Several streets on the East Side of Buffalo are named after fruits, yet residents in this predominantly Black neighborhood have few places to buy them. Residents in the Fruit Belt area are struggling to buy groceries following a mass shooting at the neighborhood’s only supermarket last month that left 10 people dead.

title: 沃尔玛在商店下架MyPillow产品
description: 沃尔玛成为最新一家停止在门店销售MyPillow Inc.产品的零售商。

title: Walmart Pulling MyPillow Products from Shelves
description: Mike Lindell, chief executive of MyPillow. Walmart is no longer carrying MyPillow products in stores, but they remain available online. Walmart Inc . is the latest retailer to say it is no longer carrying MyPillow Inc. products in stores. MyPillow’s chief executive, Mike Lindell , faces litigation over his unproven claims of fraud in the 2020 election.

title: Thousands of Cattle Die in Kansas As Heat Wave Scorches Parts of the U.S.
description: Dangerous heat killed thousands of cattle in the nation’s heartland and led to dozens of hospital visits as high temperatures scorched parts of the U.S.Temperatures rose into the 90s and 100s in the South and Midwest, with high humidity amplifying the sweltering conditions in some places, according to the National Weather Service. Dozens of cities are breaking or flirting with record highs, the weather agency said.

title: 马斯克称他首次把选票投给一位共和党人
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/马斯克称他首次把选票投给一位共和党人-11655337306
description: 特斯拉(Tesla Inc., TSLA)首席执行官马斯克(Elon Musk)说，他把选票投给了得州议员候选人Mayra Flores，这是他第一次投票给共和党人，同时他提议为温和派创建一个政治行动委员会。 马斯克周三在Twitter上说，"2022年将出现大规模的红色浪潮。" ...

title: Elon Musk Says He Voted for a Republican for the First Time, Leaning Toward DeSantis for President
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Alex Leary,The Wall Street Journal
description: “Massive red wave in 2022,” Mr. Musk said on Twitter Wednesday. In a special election Tuesday, Ms. Flores, a Republican, defeated a Democrat in a district partially bordering Mexico that President Biden carried by 4 percentage points in 2020. “I woke up this morning still feeling surreal from everything that’s happened over the last 24 hours,” Ms. Flores said in a tweet Wednesday.

title: Real-Estate Firms Redfin and Compass Shed Jobs as Housing Market Slows
description: Two real-estate brokerage firms said on Tuesday that they were laying off hundreds of employees as rising mortgage rates and record housing prices cool the housing market. Compass Inc. is laying off 10%, or approximately 450, of its employees, according to a regulatory filing. Redfin Corp. is cutting 6% of its workforce, or 470 people, by the end of the month, it said in a filing.

title: Teen Who Fell to His Death at Amusement Park Exceeded Ride’s Weight Limit by About 100 Pounds, Autopsy Shows
description: Autopsy finds that the 14-year-old who died in March after falling off Icon Park’s 430-foot-tall Orlando FreeFall exceeded the ride’s weight limits. The 14-year-old boy who died in March after falling off an amusement-park ride in Florida exceeded the ride’s weight limit by about 100 pounds, according to an autopsy report. Tyre Sampson fell during the descent of a 430-foot-tall ride called the Orlando FreeFall at Florida’s Icon Park.

title: 美国汽油平均价格首次升至5美元/加仑
link: https://cn.wsj.com/articles/美国汽油平均价格首次升至5美元-加仑-11655078706
description: 美国每加仑普通无铅汽油的平均价格上周五晚间达到5美元，而且预计燃料成本的上涨将在整个繁忙的夏季驾驶季节延续。 根据能源数据和分析供应商OPIS的数据，这一价格创下纪录新高。目前美国消费者价格通胀率达到40年来最高水平，同时原油价格居高不下。 ...

title: Gasoline Prices Reach $5 a Gallon Nationwide for the First Time
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Hardika Singh,The Wall Street Journal
description: Gas prices skyrocketed after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine earlier this year, with traders, shippers and financiers shunning Russian oil supplies. Oil inventories, which were already tight because of higher demand from economic reopening, have depleted even more, with no sign of relief ahead.

title: Harvey Weinstein Faces Charges of Indecent Assault in U.K.
description: June 8, 2022 11:53 am ETHarvey Weinstein, the disgraced former Hollywood producer, faces charges in the U.K. on two counts of indecent assault against a woman in London in 1996. The Crown Prosecution Service said Wednesday it authorized the charges “following a review of the evidence gathered by the Metropolitan Police.” The CPS prosecutes criminal cases that have been investigated by law-enforcement agencies in England and Wales. Continue reading your article witha WSJ membership

title: Three Police Officers Placed on Leave After Watching Man Drown in Arizona
description: June 7, 2022 11:09 am ETThree Arizona police officers were placed on administrative leave after allegedly witnessing a man drowning without diving in the water to save him, according to officials and video footage of the incident. The officers placed on leave were responding to a reported fight between a couple in Tempe, Ariz. on May 28, when they encountered Sean Bickings, 34 years old.

title: Gunman Who Killed Four People in Tulsa Hospital Had Back Surgery There in May
description: Police officers responding to a call about a man armed with a rifle at the St. Francis Hospital in Tulsa, Okla. Police said the gunman who shot and killed four people in a Tulsa, Okla., hospital had undergone back surgery there in May. The alleged gunman opened fire in the Natalie Medical Building at St. Francis Hospital on Wednesday, killing the doctor who performed the surgery and three others before dying of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Victim of New York Subway Mass Shooting Sues Gun Maker Glock
description: June 1, 2022 2:21 pm ETA woman injured during the April mass shooting on the New York City subway is suing the company that manufactures the gun used in the attack. Brooklyn resident Ilene Steur filed a lawsuit in New York federal court against gun maker Glock GmbH and its U.S. unit, Glock Inc., this week. The suit alleges the Austrian gun maker flooded the market with weapons and failed to train dealers to avoid illegal transactions.

title: UEFA Investigates Champions League Final Chaos
description: Europe’s soccer governing body is investigating chaotic scenes from Saturday’s Champions League final near Paris, where French police say they had trouble maintaining order as people tried to enter the stadium without tickets. Footage from the scene at Stade de France shows police using tear gas and pepper spray on crowds outside the stadium, including near children.

title: Thousands of Students Walk Out of Schools to Protest Gun Violence After Texas Shooting
description: May 27, 2022 3:45 pm ETThousands of students across the U.S. walked out of classrooms this week in protest against gun violence days after the deadliest school shooting in nearly a decade. Students and staff at more than 200 schools in at least 34 states staged walkouts this week, according to the nonprofit Everytown for Gun Safety, a gun violence prevention group.

title: Gas Prices Are Surging, Demand Is Slipping Ahead of Memorial Day Weekend
description: May 27, 2022 5:30 am ET Record high gas prices are starting to take a toll on the American consumer. Demand for gasoline in mid-May fell to one of its lowest levels for this time of year in nearly a decade, according to government data. The drop is an early indicator that rising gas prices are prompting some Americans to change their driving habits ahead of Memorial Day weekend and what is typically the peak summer driving season.

title: Texas School Shooting Victims Were Killed in One Classroom
description: All the victims killed in the mass shooting at a Texas elementary school Tuesday were in the same classroom, a law-enforcement official said, as details about both the victims and how the massacre unfolded continued to emerge.  Lt. Christopher Olivarez of the Texas Department of Public Safety said the 18-year-old shooter had barricaded himself in a fourth-grade classroom when he started firing.

title: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band to Embark on 2023 World Tour
description: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band performed in Barcelona in May 2016 during ‘The River Tour.’The Boss is going back on tour. Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band announced that they will be hitting the road starting early next year, in what will be their first tour together since February 2017.

title: Accused Buffalo Shooting Suspect Payton Gendron Appears in Court
description: BUFFALO, N.Y.—The gunman accused of killing 10 people in a grocery store in a predominantly Black neighborhood briefly appeared in Erie County court Thursday. Payton Gendron , 18 years old, was arraigned on murder charges over the weekend. He pleaded not guilty.

title: NY銃乱射に「交代」説の影響 早わかりQ&A
description: 2022 年 5 月 18 日 10:37 JST 米ニューヨーク州バファローで起きた銃乱射事件の容疑者はネットに投稿した180ページに及ぶ文書で、「大交代」として知られる陰謀説に言及していた。法執行当局者が明らかにした。容疑者は文書の中で犯行現場のスーパーを標的にした理由について、黒人が多く住む地域にあるためとし、できる限り多くの黒人を殺したいと述べていた。 この誤った理論は、ここ数年に起こった移民や宗教・民族・人種上のマイノリティー（少数派）を狙った攻撃でも、犯人が言及していた。 以下、大交代理論についてまとめた。 交代理論とは何か 「大交代」とは、エリート層（政治家や財界首脳、メディア）が移民政策などを利用して白人の人口を減らそうとしていると主張する陰謀説だ。 研究者によると、米国では近年、非白人と比べて白人の割合が低下していることで、この陰謀論に関心を寄せる、あるいは信じる人が増えている。米国勢調査局によると、非ヒスパニック（中南米）系白人の人口は2010～2020年に2.6％低下。2045年までには非白人の人口が白人の人口を抜くと予想されている。 交代理論の起源とは...

title: What Is Replacement Theory? What We Know About the Conspiracy Theory Linked to the Buffalo Gunman
description: What Is Replacement Theory? What We Know About the Conspiracy Theory Linked to the Buffalo GunmanThe false claims have been cited by gunmen in previous attacks targeting immigrants and religious, ethnic and racial minorities

title: Buffalo Shooting Victims Identified as Biden Plans Trip to ‘Grieve With the Community’
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Ginger Adams Otis,The Wall Street Journal
description: Law-enforcement officials released the names of the 10 people killed in the mass shooting at a Buffalo, N.Y., supermarket, which is being investigated as a possible hate crime. The deceased victims ranged in age from their early 30s to mid-80s. Most were from Buffalo, including Roberta A. Drury, 32; Celestine Chaney, 65; Katherine Massey, 72; Margus D. Morrison, 52; Heyward Patterson, 67; Geraldine Talley, 62; Ruth Whitfield, 86; and Pearl Young, 77.

title: Coastal Fire Sets 20 Homes Ablaze in Southern California’s Laguna Niguel
description: A coastal fire in Southern California that began Wednesday spread quickly, burning at least 20 homes and prompting several evacuation orders. The fire, accelerated by winds, covered nearly 200 acres by 11 p.m. local time, officials in Orange County said. Video footage showed smoke covering forested areas and neighborhoods, with flames swallowing large homes in Laguna Niguel, Calif., which is roughly 50 miles southeast of Los Angeles and sits between Laguna Beach and Dana Point.

title: Duke Commencement Speaker Takes ‘Full Responsibility’ After Similarities in Speech Spark University Probe
description: A Duke University student said she is taking “full responsibility” for parts of her commencement speech that included passages similar to those in a Harvard University graduation speech years ago, prompting a university probe. Undergraduate commencement speaker Priya Parkash spoke to her fellow classmates at Duke’s graduation ceremony on Sunday.

title: Trump-aligned broadcaster OAN airs segment admitting Georgia election workers 'did not engage in ballot fraud or criminal misconduct'
description: By Omar Abdel-Baqui One America News Network walked back previous false claims it made on air about voter fraud in Georgia as part of a settlement with two election workers who sued it for defamation. In a segment that airedon the conservative network Monday, an OAN TV presenter citing a Georgia state investigation said election workers Ruby Freeman and Wandrea Moss "did not engage in ballot fraud or criminal misconduct."

title: Trump-aligned broadcaster OAN airs segment admitting Georgia election workers 'did not engage in ballot fraud or criminal misconduct'
description: By Omar Abdel-Baqui One America News Network walked back previous false claims it made on air about voter fraud in Georgia as part of a settlement with two election workers who sued it for defamation. In a segment that airedon the conservative network Monday, an OAN TV presenter citing a Georgia state investigation said election workers Ruby Freeman and Wandrea Moss "did not engage in ballot fraud or criminal misconduct."

title: OAN Walks Back Voter Fraud Claims as Part of Defamation Settlement
description: Updated May 10, 2022 4:03 pm ETOne America News Network walked back previous false claims it made on air about voter fraud in Georgia as part of a settlement with two election workers who sued it for defamation. In a segment that aired on the conservative network Monday, an OAN TV presenter citing a Georgia state investigation said election workers Ruby Freeman and Wandrea Moss “did not engage in ballot fraud or criminal misconduct.”Copyright ©2024 Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

title: Three Americans Found Dead, One Hospitalized After Falling Ill at Sandals Resort in Bahamas
description: Three U.S. citizens have been found dead and one has been hospitalized after falling ill at a resort in the Bahamas since Friday, according to the Royal Bahamas Police Force. Bahamian police are investigating the deaths and hospitalization at the Sandals Emerald Bay resort on Great Exuma. The affected Americans experienced similar symptoms, including vomiting and convulsions, Royal Bahamas Police Commissioner Paul Rolle said Monday in an interview.

title: Suspect in Dave Chappelle Attack Faces Four Misdemeanor Charges
description: A 23-year-old man arrested for allegedly attacking Dave Chappelle while the comedian was performing in Los Angeles earlier this week faces four misdemeanor charges, according to the Los Angeles City Attorney’s Office.  City Attorney Mike Feuer said his office is charging suspect Isaiah Lee with battery, possession of a weapon with intent to assault and two counts relating to unauthorized access of a stage and disruption of a performance.

title: F1 Racing Is Coming to Miami. For Some Residents, It’s All Sound and Fury.
description: The lawsuit, filed in Florida circuit court in March, alleges the race will bring noise levels that will result in hearing loss and disrupt residents’ lives. There are homes within 400 feet of the race site, and some residents say they can’t afford to leave the area during race weekend. “A Formula One race in the middle of a Black bedroom community—are you kidding me?” said Betty Ferguson, a Miami Gardens resident born and raised in the area who is part of the lawsuit.

title: The 19 Investors Backing Elon Musk’s Twitter Deal: Here’s the List
description: Elon Musk’s offer to buy Twitter has attracted over $7 billion in fresh financing from 19 investors, he said in a filing. Mr. Musk, the Tesla chief executive, said he has received commitment letters from a range of investors, including $1 billion from Oracle Corp. co-founder Larry Ellison; $800 million from Sequoia Capital Fund LP, a venture capital fund that focuses on internet startups; and $700 million from tech investment firm VyCapital.

title: Dave Chappelle Attacked Onstage During Comedy Festival at Hollywood Bowl
description: Comedian Dave Chappelle was attacked onstage during a show in Los Angeles Tuesday night, according to law enforcement and footage from the event. A man tackled Mr. Chappelle as the comedian was wrapping up his show at the Hollywood Bowl, the Los Angeles Police Department said. The suspect was armed with a knife and was arrested for assault with a deadly weapon, an LAPD spokeswoman said.

title: Amazon’s Whole Foods Is Closing Six Stores: Here’s the List
description: Amazon.com Inc.-owned Whole Foods Market is closing six stores, a move that comes after the e-commerce giant last week reported its first quarterly loss in seven years. The stores that are closing are in Montgomery and Mobile, Ala.; Tarzana, Calif.; Brookline, Mass.; and two locations in Chicago, according to Whole Foods.

title: James Corden to Leave ‘The Late Late Show’ Next Year
description: “I never want this show to overstay its welcome in any way. I always want to love making it,” he said. “I really think in a year from now that’ll be a good time to move on.” A CBS spokeswoman said Mr. Corden’s contract will end in spring 2023. She declined to comment on terms of the deal.

title: Lawmakers Look to Ban Use of Sexual-Assault Victim DNA in Unrelated Cases
description: A bill in California calls for the expungement of sexual-assault victims’ DNA in all public and private databases. State and federal lawmakers are crafting legislation that would prohibit police from using DNA of sexual-assault victims in investigations unrelated to their attacks. The bills in California and New York come after the San Francisco Police Department earlier this year linked a woman to a property crime using DNA collected from her for a rape kit six years ago.

title: 商业新闻网站Quartz将被G/O Media收购
description: 运营Deadspin、Gizmodo和Jezebel等网站的G/O Media将收购在线商业新闻网站Quartz，这是不断整合的数字媒体领域的最新交易。 G/O Media和Quartz的代表不予透露交易价格。 Quartz的首席执行官Zach Seward将留任总编辑。他在写给员工的信中说，交易不会导致裁员。他说，Quartz的新闻部门将保持独立，专注报道全球商业新闻和分析文章。 ...

title: Business News Site Quartz Bought by G/O Media
authors: Omar Abdel-Baqui,Alexandra Bruell,The Wall Street Journal
description: Zach Seward, the chief executive at Quartz, will stay at the company as its editor in chief. There will be no staff cuts due to the sale, he said in a letter to employees. The Quartz newsroom will remain independent and focused on global business news and analysis, he said. “Joining a larger firm will provide more resources for our most strapped teams at Quartz and more opportunities for career growth across the new company,” Mr. Seward said in the letter.

title: SOME PERSONAL NEWS: ELON MUSK'S TWITTER DEAL HAS EVERYONE ATWITTER ABOUT ALL THINGS TWITTER ON TWITTER
authors: Joseph Pisani,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: ABSTRACTPeople are going on Twitter to swear they will not use Twitter if Elon Musk’s deal for social-media platform goes through, and hashtag #LeavingTwitter is trending (M)

title: Where Were You When Elon Musk Agreed to Buy Twitter? Probably on Twitter
authors: Joseph Pisani,Omar Abdel-Baqui,The Wall Street Journal
description: Twitter users express their many thoughts, to each other, on Twitter; ‘I feel seen’ April 27, 2022 3:24 pm ET Now trending on Twitter : Twitter.    Twitter users have a lot to say about Twitter selling itself to Elon Musk for $44 billion. And they’re using Twitter to say it. Resume Subscription We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription. You will be charged $ + tax (if applicable) for The Wall Street Journal.

title: This Billionaire Is Now Even Richer Than Warren Buffett
description: Warren Buffett is now looking up to someone else on the list of the world’s richest people. Indian industrialist Gautam Adani has become the fifth richest person in the world, surpassing Mr. Buffett, with a net worth of $125 billion as of Tuesday, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, a ranking of the richest people in the world updated each business day.

title: Anti-Semitic Incidents in U.S. Jump to New High, Report Says
description: The number of reported anti-Semitic incidents in the U.S., including assaults, vandalism and harassment, rose to a new high last year, according to data from the Anti-Defamation League. There were more than 2,700 reported anti-Semitic incidents in 2021, a roughly 34% increase from 2020 and the highest number on record since the ADL—a Jewish advocacy group that examines anti-Semitism in the U.S.— began tracking these figures in 1979.

title: Gap Shares Drop 18% on Lower Sales Expectations
description: Gap Inc.— which operates the Gap, Old Navy and Banana Republic brands—cited ‘macroeconomic dynamics as well as execution challenges’ at Old Navy for its weaker sales outlook. Gap Inc . shares fell 18% Friday, after the retailer cut its fiscal first-quarter guidance and announced the departure of the president and chief executive of its Old Navy business.

title: Just Eat Takeaway Considers Putting Grubhub Up for Sale After Orders Fall
description: Online food ordering company Just Eat Takeaway.com NV is considering selling its U.S. unit Grubhub after reporting a decline in orders following a boom in sales during Covid-19 lockdowns. The company said it was exploring the introduction of a strategic partner or the partial or full sale of the U.S.-based food delivery service. Just Eat bought Grubhub last year for $7.3 billion.

title: Dow Jones celebrates 2023 achievements - Editor and Publisher
description: Posted Thursday, December 21, 2023 1:29 pm In an increasingly complex world, Dow Jones met the moment and delivered trusted information for people to make decisions in business, policy and at the kitchen table.” Dow Jones & Company, a leading global business news and information services provider, has shared some of its most notable achievements from 2023, including award-winning journalism, an expanded portfolio of products and services to meet the needs of businesses and a growing lineup of...

title: Dow Jones and Cision unveil exclusive global content partnership for PR, corporate communications market - Editor and Publisher
description: Posted Thursday, September 7, 2023 9:50 am By joining forces with Cision, we're expanding the reach of our business news and information that meets our audiences where they are while also furthering our investment in unique, high-quality journalism.” Cision, the leading provider of consumer and media intelligence and communications solutions, has entered into a long-term agreement to distribute Dow Jones content to public relations and corporate communications professionals (PRCC). This new...

title: „WSJ“-Reporter: Deutschland kann helfen, Evan nach Hause zu bringen
description: In den mehr als 30 Jahren, die seit dem Fall der Berliner Mauer und der Wiedervereinigung vergangen sind, ist ganz Deutschland zu einem Leuchtturm der Freiheit und der offenen Gesellschaft geworden.

title: „WSJ“-Reporter: Deutschland kann helfen, Evan nach Hause zu bringen
description: In den mehr als 30 Jahren, die seit dem Fall der Berliner Mauer und der Wiedervereinigung vergangen sind, ist ganz Deutschland zu einem Leuchtturm der Freiheit und der offenen Gesellschaft geworden.

title: Prezydent Duda w Londynie: Czynimy wszystko, by NATO było jak najsilniejsze [WYWIAD]
description: Z Andrzejem Dudą rozmawia Almar Latour, CEO Dow Jones Żyjemy w czasach, kiedy współpraca międzynarodowa jest tak ważna, jak jeszcze nigdy. Więzi transatlantyckie są tak silne, jak nigdy wcześniej. Jak w ciągu ostatnich siedmiu lat wyglądały, a jak będą wyglądać stosunki Europy ze Stanami Zjednoczonymi? To pytanie jest bardzo złożone.

title: Andrzej Duda w Londynie: Czynimy wszystko, by NATO było jak najsilniejsze
description: Zapis rozmowy, jaka odbyła się 24 maja w Londynie podczas zorganizowanego przez DGP spotkania w ramach WSJ Global CEO Summit WYDANIE SPECJALNE Z LONDYNU. DGP WE WSPÓŁPRACY Z THE WALL STREET JOURNAL>>> Almar Latour, CEO Dow Jones: Żyjemy w czasach, kiedy współpraca międzynarodowa jest tak ważna, jak jeszcze nigdy. Więzi transatlantyckie są tak silne, jak nigdy wcześniej.
